studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Synopsis; Section 3.1; Section 10.1; Section 11.2; Section 11.3; Section 17.9.1
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Redefinition of clinical cut-off for final CSR analysis and transition to long-term survival follow-up.
Clarification of permitted and prohibited vaccinations, specifically regarding live-attenuated vaccines.
Introduction of Subcutaneous (SC) daratumumab administration as an alternative to Intravenous (IV) during COVID-19.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Time and Events Schedule; Section 8.1.7; Section 9.8
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Implementation of Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) screening and monitoring due to new identified risk of reactivation.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To define the clinical cut-off for the final CSR analysis and timing of final OS analysis.
To provide flexibility for investigators to prioritize patient safety during the global COVID-19 pandemic.
In response to identification of a new important risk (hepatitis B virus [HBV] reactivation).
IDMC recommendation following positive second interim analysis to allow Arm A subjects access to daratumumab.

studyChanges.summary: Updated terminology to distinguish between final OS analysis and the actual end of study.

studyChanges.afterText: Second primary malignancies added to medically important events.
studyChanges.summary: Expanded definition of medically important serious adverse events.
Added subcutaneous route of administration for daratumumab.

studyChanges.afterText: Subjects whose dose was delayed for more than 4 weeks (Cycle 1 to 6) or 6 weeks (Cycle 7+) should have study treatment discontinued unless sponsor agrees otherwise.
studyChanges.summary: Tightened requirements for treatment discontinuation due to prolonged dose delays.

studyChanges.afterText: Subjects randomized to Arm A (Rd) who have sponsor-confirmed disease progression may have the option to receive daratumumab.
studyChanges.summary: Added provision for cross-over/subsequent daratumumab therapy for the control arm.
